channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Federal Experts Talk Bird Flu ‘What Ifs’ in WebMD Live Event
item.description: WebMD brought together experts from four federal agencies to talk prevention, monitoring, and what the “what ifs” of bird flu might look like.

item.title: My Word for 2024: Strong
item.description: Before I begin, know that I fully recognize that it’s May. I selected my word of the year way back in December of 2023. After letting it marinade for a few days, I spent an hour looking for the perfect bracelet on Etsy that would display its letters each and every day. I also knew... Read More

item.title: If You See Fine Lines Around The Eye, You May Need This Antioxidant
item.description: If you've spent too much money on eye creams that claim to make fine lines around the eyes disappear, you may want to switch them out for this antioxidant.

item.title: Mayo Clinic Minute: Can lifestyle changes help with enlarged prostate?
item.description: Benign prostatic hyperplasia, also called an enlarged prostate, is incredibly common, especially among men over 40. While it's not the same as prostate cancer, an enlarged prostate can cause significant quality of life issues. Dr. Scott Cheney, a Mayo Clinic urologist, says there are ways to treat it and reduce the symptoms, including some lifestyle […] The post Mayo Clinic Minute: Can lifestyle changes help with enlarged prostate? appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: What’s Next in Health Care for Older Adults: Questions and Answers With John Whyte, MD
item.description: As WebMD’s chief medical officer, John Whyte, MD, is in a unique position to see both the current state of medical care for America’s older adults and the way things are trending for the future. We asked him to share his insight on a few topics, along with a bit of advice.

item.title: The Sound of Freedom
item.description: For a million years (more like 15,) I’ve been listening to a radio show: The Taylor Strecker Show. It’s a daily show that originated on SiriusXM and through a series of events became an independently broadcasted show on Patreon. There’s something interesting that happens when you listen to a daily show. You get to know... Read More

item.title: Advances in medulloblastoma treatment for children
item.description: By Nicole Brudos Ferrara Though rare, medulloblastoma is the most common cancerous brain tumor in children. These tumors begin in the lower back part of the brain called the cerebellum, which is important for balance, coordination and movement. Medulloblastomas are embryonal tumors that grow from embryonal cells left over from fetal development. "Of all the tumors we see […] The post Advances in medulloblastoma treatment for children appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: Get the Care You Need in a COVID-19 World
item.description: What to expect at the doctor’s office, hospitals, and long-term care facilities, the future of telemedicine, and how to get the best care during COVID-19.

item.title: Mayo Clinic Minute: Menopause and the heart connection
item.description: Women experience menopause at different ages — and different ways — which can, among other things, affect their heart health. The average age of natural menopause in the U.S is 52. There's early menopause, under age 45, and premature menopause, under age 40, which may affect a very small group of women. There is also premature […] The post Mayo Clinic Minute: Menopause and the heart connection appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.description: A savvy black entrepreneur guides you on an eczema-friendly shopping spree.

item.title: Mayo Clinic Minute: Poor sleep can be linked to stroke
item.description: Sleep probems can increase someone's risk of stroke. Sleep problems can include too little sleep (less than five hours), too much sleep (more than nine hours), poor quality, difficulty getting to sleep or staying asleep, prolonged napping, and snoring and breathing cessation. In this Mayo Clinic Minute, Dr. Stephen English, a Mayo Clinic vascular neurologist, […] The post Mayo Clinic Minute: Poor sleep can be linked to stroke appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: Behind the Spike in Colorectal Cancer Among Young Americans
item.description: Colorectal cancer cases increased a whopping 333% among 15- to 19-year-olds and 185% among 20- to 24-year-olds from 1999 to 2020.

item.title: ‘I’m so happy we’re here:’ An unexpected diagnosis saves Rich Bugay’s life
item.description: Rich Bugay had an appointment with the Division of Gastroenterology and Hepatology at Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota, on a Monday, where he had hoped to get answers and relief for what he thought was refractory acid reflux — until his doctor discovered a heart murmur. The next morning, Rich was told he had congenital […] The post ‘I’m so happy we’re here:’ An unexpected diagnosis saves Rich Bugay’s life appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .
